alert.note: Alert for Motherlode (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 14 at 3:48AM PST until December 14 at 6:00AM PST by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...Dangerous Winter Storm to Produce Very Heavy Snow with Strong Winds and Whiteout Conditions... .A strong winter storm continues to bring very heavy snow to the mountains and foothills of northern California. Moderate to heavy snow showers will continue into Tuesday. Snow levels have dropped to around 1500 feet with snow into some of the lower foothill communities. Another winter storm with low snow levels and heavy snow will affect northern California Wednesday and Thursday. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM PST EARLY THIS MORNING ABOVE 1500 FEET... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING ABOVE 2000 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy wet snow possible above 1500 feet. Plan on difficult travel conditions, including during the morning commute. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches are expected. Localized amounts up to 8 inches, are possible. * WHERE...Motherlode. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 6 AM today. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Wednesday afternoon through Thursday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Be prepared for significant reductions in visibility at times. Significant reductions in visibility are possible. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Storm Warning for snow means there will be snow covered roads and limited visibilities. Travel is not recommended while the warning is in effect. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
